channel.title: [SRL][RS2][UPDATED] Minitual Autofighter -- 2.61-- Sweet new procedures
channel.description: NEW: (2.61) A million new procedures, works a lot better, I'm really proud of what I've done so far and have some stuff that I think you guys are going to be impressed with. BTW, I haven't really tested the switching players yet so tell me how that works. Also, if the bot tries to find a new fight prematurely (I made a new function that detects if something has died near it (within a big circle), later, I'll narrow that circle down so it doesn't glitch out so much) then tell me about that too. Tell me what you think, and look at the code!

item.title: [SRL][RS2][UPDATED] Minitual Autofighter -- 2.61-- Sweet new procedures
item.dc:creator: @minitual minitual
item.description:
@minitual wrote:

In the code of the autoer, it will say something like //USER VARIABLES//, under here is where you make your settings. MonsterColor1-6 is where you input the colors of the monster you are fighting. UserPlayerForm is set to true if it is the first time you are running the script. RotateScreen simply rotates the screen, CheckUpText should probably be left true if you don’t know what you’re doing, and everything else is pretty easy to understand. What UsePlayerForm does is open up SRL’s player manager and let’s you enter your user/pass/nick combination. You can enter more than one character and the TimeToRun=25 means that it will run your character for 25 minutes, then switch characters, and keep doing this. If you only want one character just set TimeToRun to be really high (in the 500 minutes range) and it will never get a chance to switch.
There isn’t any specific place you have to train, it all just depends on what color settings you have.

Read full topic

@minitual wrote:

I’ll definately look into the mouse procedures…

NEW UPDATE:
Everything’s new pretty much. Works real well (I think). A lot of new functions that I think are pretty innovative

The only reason I’m releasing this is because the other one doesn’t work too well. I really wanted to wait a few days to make it a lot better but this should work pretty good.
Next release will be a HUGE jump in everything. Will detect the end of fights better, will rotate better, will switch players better, so on so on.

item.title: [SRL][RS2][UPDATED] Minitual Autofighter -- 2.61-- Sweet new procedures
item.dc:creator: @Coolnoob55 Coolnoob55
item.description:
@Coolnoob55 wrote:

For another good mouse procedure use DEADs its teh 0wnage
[scar]var
x,y,curangle:integer;
i,j:extended;

function loge(i:extended) : extended;
var
count,exp:integer;
xval:extended;
begin
exp:= 1;
xval:= (i - 1) / (i + 1);
for count:= 1 to 5 do
begin
result:= result + pow(xval,exp)/exp;
exp:= exp + 2;
end;
result:= result * 2;
end;

function logb(base,i:extended) : extended;
begin
result:= loge(i)/loge(base);
end;

function abs(i : extended) : extended;
begin
i:= sqrt(i*i);
result := i;
end;

function fact(i : integer) : integer;
var
holdi,res : integer;
begin
holdi := i;
res := 1;
for i := 1 to holdi do
begin
res := i * res
end;
result := res;
end;

function arctan(e : extended) : extended;
var
count : integer;
res : extended;
inv : boolean;
begin
if(abs(e) > 1)then
begin
e := pow(e,-1);
inv := true;
end else
begin
inv := false;
end;
for count := 0 to 6 do
begin
res := res + ( ( pow(2,2 * count) * pow(fact(count),2) ) / fact(2 * count + 1) ) * ( ( pow(e,2*count+1) ) / ( pow(1 + pow(e,2),count + 1) ) );
end;
if(inv)then
begin
res := 1.5707963267 - res;
end;
result := res;
end;

procedure findintercept(targx,targy,radius:integer);
begin
x:= round(x + i * radius);
y:= round(y + j * radius);
end;

procedure adjangle(targx,targy,rate:integer);
var
targangle,degrees,angledifft,anglediffc:integer;
radians:extended;
begin
if(targx - x = 0) or (targy - y = 0)then
begin
if(targx - x = 0)then
begin
if(targy - y > 0)then
begin
targangle:= 270;
end else
begin
targangle:= 90;
end;
end;
if(targy - y = 0)then
begin
if(targx - x > 0)then
begin
targangle:= 180;
end else
begin
targangle:= 0;
end;
end;
end else
begin
degrees:= round(arctan(abs((x - targx)/(y - targy))) * 180 / pi);
if(targx - x > 0)then
begin
if(targy - y > 0)then
begin
targangle:= 90 - degrees;
end else
begin
targangle:= 270 + degrees;
end;
end else
begin
if(targy - y > 0)then
begin
targangle:= 90 + degrees;
end else
begin
targangle:= 270 - degrees;
end;
end;
end;
anglediffc:= curangle - targangle;
angledifft:= targangle - curangle;
if(anglediffc < 0)then
begin
anglediffc:= anglediffc + 360;
end;
if(angledifft < 0)then
begin
angledifft:= angledifft + 360;
end;
if(curangle <> targangle)then
begin
if(angledifft > anglediffc)then
begin
curangle:= curangle - round(rate / 100 * anglediffc);
end else
begin
curangle:= curangle + round(rate / 100 * angledifft);
end;
end;
radians:= curangle * pi / 180;
i:= cos(radians);
j:= sin(radians);
end;

procedure bump();
begin
if(random(10) < 1)then
begin
curangle:= round(curangle - 0.5 * 40 + random(40));
end;
end;

procedure accelerate(targx,targy,speed,acceleration:integer; var curspeed:extended; var decelerate:boolean);
var
dist,dedist,deceleration,time:extended;
begin
deceleration:= -acceleration / 100 + 1;
if(curspeed <> 0)then
begin
dist:= sqrt(pow(targx - x, 2) + pow(targy - y, 2));
time:= logb(deceleration,5/curspeed);
dedist:= curspeed * (1 - pow(deceleration,time))/(1 - deceleration);
end else
begin
dedist:= dist - 1;
end;
if(dist < dedist)then
begin
decelerate:= true;
end;
if(decelerate)then
begin
if(curspeed > 5)then
begin
curspeed:= curspeed * deceleration;
end;
end else
begin
curspeed:= curspeed + acceleration / 100 * (speed - curspeed);
end;
// writeln(floattostr(curspeed));
// writeln(floattostr(dist) + ‘:’ + floattostr(time) + ‘:’ + floattostr(dedist));
end;

procedure changeturnspeed(targx,targy,turnspeed,totaldist:integer; var curturnspeed :integer);
var
dist:extended;
hold:integer;
begin
dist:= sqrt(pow(targx - x, 2) + pow(targy - y, 2));
hold:= round(pow(100 - turnspeed,pow((totaldist - dist)/totaldist,2)) + turnspeed);
if(hold > curturnspeed)then
begin
curturnspeed:= hold;
end;
end;

procedure randomcurangle(targx,targy:integer);
var
targangle,degrees:integer;
begin
if(targx - x = 0) or (targy - y = 0)then
begin
if(targx - x = 0)then
begin
if(targy - y > 0)then
begin
targangle:= 270;
end else
begin
targangle:= 90;
end;
end;
if(targy - y = 0)then
begin
if(targx - x > 0)then
begin
targangle:= 180;
end else
begin
targangle:= 0;
end;
end;
end else
begin
degrees:= round(arctan(abs((x - targx)/(y - targy))) * 180 / pi);
if(targx - x > 0)then
begin
if(targy - y > 0)then
begin
targangle:= 90 - degrees;
end else
begin
targangle:= 270 + degrees;
end;
end else
begin
if(targy - y > 0)then
begin
targangle:= 90 + degrees;
end else
begin
targangle:= 270 - degrees;
end;
end;
end;
curangle:= targangle - 45 + random(90);
if(curangle > 0)then
begin
curangle:= curangle + 360;
end;
end;

procedure gravity(gravpointx,gravpointy,grav,pull:integer);
var
gravx,gravy:integer;
slope:extended;
begin
if(x - gravpointx = 0)or(y - gravpointy = 0)then
begin
if(x - gravpointx = 0)then
begin
gravy:= grav;
end else
begin
gravx:= grav;
end;
end else
begin
slope:= (x - gravx)/(y - gravy);
gravx:= round(grav/(1 + slope));
gravy:= round((grav/(1 + slope)) * slope);
end;
if(gravpointx > x)then
begin
x:= x - gravx;
end else
begin
x:= x + gravx;
end;
if(gravpointy > y)then
begin
y:= y - gravy;
end else
begin
y:= y + gravy;
end;
end;

procedure deadmouse(targx,targy,maxspeed,turnspeed,acceleration:integer; finishingtouch:boolean);
var
curspeed:extended;
square,totaldistance,curturnspeed,grav,gravpointx,gravpointy,pull:integer;
decelerate:boolean;
begin
getmousepos(x,y);
curspeed:= 0;
totaldistance:= round(sqrt(pow(targx - x, 2) + pow(targy - y, 2)));
randomcurangle(targx,targy);
pull:= random(2);
gravpointx:= random(round(abs(targx-x)));
gravpointy:= random(round(abs(targy-y)));
if(targx > x)then
begin
gravpointx:= targx - gravpointx;
end else
begin
gravpointx:= targx + gravpointx;
end;
if(targy > y)then
begin
gravpointy:= targy - gravpointy;
end else
begin
gravpointy:= targy + gravpointy;
end;
repeat
accelerate(targx,targy,maxspeed,acceleration,curspeed,decelerate);
changeturnspeed(targx,targy,turnspeed,totaldistance,curturnspeed);
adjangle(targx,targy,curturnspeed);
findintercept(targx,targy,round(curspeed));
if(decelerate <> true)then
begin
gravity(gravpointx,gravpointy,grav,pull);
end;
grav:= round(random(round(curspeed)) * 0.1);
bump();
square:= round(curspeed / 4);
x:= round(x + random(square) - 0.5 * square);
y:= round(y + random(square) - 0.5 * square);
movemouse(x,y);
wait(10);
until(y < targy + 10)and(y > targy - 10)and(x < targx + 10)and(x > targx - 10);
if(finishingtouch)then
begin
movemouse(targx,targy)
end;
end;

//example of use could be deadmouse(600,200,20,5,10,true);
[/scar]
Go to the SRL procedure section for this

Read full topic

item.title: [SRL][RS2][UPDATED] Minitual Autofighter -- 2.61-- Sweet new procedures
item.dc:creator: @minitual minitual
item.description:
@minitual wrote:

Thanks for posting the progress report. I’m now on version 2.5 (I’ll upload it in the next week, after more testing, there’s a lot of changes and updates) and the randoms are a little bit better but mostly it’s just SRL. If the randoms aren’t working, it might be the way you have your username and nick set up. For example: if my username was minitual (don’t worry, already banned), in my program I would have username=‘minitual’ and UserNick=‘nitu’. Basically, what you do is take part of your name (don’t include the first letter of your name), and that’s your nick. That’s probably why it isn’t getting some of the randoms.
Thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: [SRL][RS2][UPDATED] Minitual Autofighter -- 2.61-- Sweet new procedures
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

If you need a good mouse procedure, Real Rune made an incredible one, I’ll post it here.

Copy this into Scar 2.03/Includes/SRL/SRL/MouseFlag.scar right after the MMouse procedure, dont change anything.

[scar]{*******************************************************************************
procedure MMouse2(X, Y, Rx, Ry: Integer);
By: Real Rune
Description: Great modification of Ben Mouse.
*******************************************************************************}

procedure IdleTime(Time, Rand: integer; Gravity: extended); forward;
procedure SiMMouse(x, y, rx, ry: Integer); // Spline Mouse From SI, slightly modded by RealRune
var
cx, cy, mx, my, ox, oy, ms: Integer;
mu, mum1, mum12, mu2, incr: Extended;
begin
GetMousePos(cx, cy);
if(x=cx)and(y=cy)then
Exit;
x := x + ((Random(rx)* 2 - Random(rx)* 2) div 2);
y := y + ((Random(ry)* 2 - Random(ry)* 2) div 2);
if(Random(2) + 1 = 1)then
begin
ox:= x + Random(Round(Abs(cx - x))) div 2;
oy:= cy + Random(Round(Abs(cy - y))) div 2;
end else
begin
ox:= cx + Random(Round(Abs(cx - x))) div 2;
oy:= y + Random(Round(Abs(cy - y))) div 2;
end;
repeat
incr := ((Random(2) + 1) / 1000) + Random(11) / 10000;
mu:= mu + incr;
mu2 := mu * mu;
mum1 := 1 - mu;
mum12 := mum1 * mum1;
mx := Trunc(cx * mum12 + 2 * ox * mum1 * mu + x * mu2);
my := Trunc(cy * mum12 + 2 * oy * mum1 * mu + y * mu2);
MoveMouse(mx, my);
ms := ms + 1;
if(ms mod 45 = 0)then
//Wait(3+Random(2));
Wait((Round(Random(2) + MouseSpeed) / 3));
until mu >= 1;
MoveMouseSmooth(x, y);
end;

procedure MMouse2(X, Y, Rx, Ry: Integer); // BenMouse, Modded by RealRune
Var
A : TPointArray;
B, C, D, Sx, Sy, Cx, Cy : Integer;
begin
GetMousePos(Sx, Sy);
C := 0;
D := 0;
if(X > Sx)then
C := -10 - Random(21)
Else
C := 10 + Random(21);
if(Y > Sy)then
D := -10 - Random(21)
Else
D := 10 + Random(21);
A := MakeMouseSplinePath(Sx, Sy, X + C, Y + D, 7, 50, 70);
For B := 0 to GetArrayLength(A) - 1 Do
begin
MoveMouse(A[B].X, A[B].Y);
Wait((Round(Random(2) + MouseSpeed) / 10));
if(Distance(Sx, Sy, x, y) < 50)then
Wait(1);
if(Random(250) = 1)then
begin
Case Random(6) Of
0 : IdleTime(100, 100, 1.0);
1 : IdleTime(100, 100, 1.0);
2 : IdleTime(100, 100, 1.0);
3 : IdleTime(150, 150, 1.0);
4 : IdleTime(200, 200, 1.0);
5 : IdleTime(500, 500, 1.0);
end;
Break;
end;
end;
Wait((Round(Random(2) + MouseSpeed) / 10));
GetMousePos(cx, cy);
if(Distance(cx, cy, x, y) < 65) and (Random(2) = 1)then
MoveMouseSmooth(x + random(Ry), y + Random(ry))
Else
SiMMouse(x + random(rx), y + random(ry), 0, 0);
if(Random(20) = 1)then
begin
Wait((Round(Random(2) + MouseSpeed) / 10));
IdleTime(100, 100, 1.0);
SiMMouse(x + random(rx), y + random(ry), 0, 0);
end;
Wait(20 + Random(20));
end;[/scar]

Then use MMouse2(x, y, randomx, randomy); as your mouse procedure. X and Y are your coordinates for the mouse to move to, and randomx and randomy give the procedure a little randomness on where the mouse ends up. Example: Say you put Randomx as 2 and Randomy as 2, then the mouse will move to somewhere within 2 pixels horizontally and vertically of x and y.

Hope this helps, and I take absolutely no credit whatsoever for this amazing procedure, this was the work of Real Rune, and his topic on this procedure is located under SRL Useful Procedures or somethin like that.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @minitual minitual
item.description:
@minitual wrote:

Actually, the SRL function InFight (or is it IsFight, I don’t remember) checks to see if your character (it doesn’t just look for the green on the screen, it specifically has your coordinates) is in fight. In my newest version (the one that hasn’t been released) it uses InFight and it is working really well. I might release it later this day.
Thanks for the advice though, I had tried to do that in this script too but was unsuccessful for whatever reason.[br][size=1]Posted at: September 09, 2006, 10:34:39 AM[/size][hr]Sorry about the double post everybody but this is version 2 of my autofighter. I think everything should work great. Tell me what you think!

Read full topic

item.title: [SRL][RS2][UPDATED] Minitual Autofighter -- 2.61-- Sweet new procedures
item.dc:creator: @minitual minitual
item.description:
@minitual wrote:

This is the BETA version of this script. I’m testing my new version on my other computer right now so it will probably be out soon. It’s a lot better than this script, so…
But if you really want to know, (I’m not sure if this is right because I haven’t looked at the code for this script in a while) then you should use the EyeDropper icon at the top of the Scar window and click it on the colors of the monster you want to fight. Then at the bottom of the screen it will say something like: “Color picked: 234324”. You should copy the 234422 part and put it into where it says MonsterColor1=234234. Then pick new colors on the monster for all the other monstercolor[number] variables. Good luck.

Read full topic
